intro: Arjona megapotamica, commonly known as the Brazilian arjona, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil and Paraguay. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, large heart-shaped leaves, and showy pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riverine forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
